item.title: Dumped vegetation and garden waste on highway, 14th August
item.description:
Wellington Lane North, outside Rosehill. Next to fire hydrant sign and opposite garages. Dumped garden cuttings of trees and grass and a pile of earth. There is also a lot of overhanging vegetation obstructing the highway and the end of the lane.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wellington Lane, Marle Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: Smashed glass, 14th August
item.description:
There’s smashed glass around the basketball court, I picked up as much as I could by hand but there’s a lot there, some in the edges of the grass too Mostly on the left hand side of the court if you look At it from The carpark There’s also rubbish in the long grass near the court, I picked up 20 odd plastic bottles, not sure why they’ve left them as the bin wasn’t full, maybe they need a sign saying please put your rubbish in the bin with an arrow on to the bin

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mill Lane, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Right of way completely blocked. Surface is dangerous with deep gully and water erosion., 14th August
item.description:
The whole length of the bridleway from Granna Lane to Nottingham Hill. This is an ancient right of way and the main bridleway in this area.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Granna Lane, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: On Elmbridge Court roundabout on exit to Longford, 14th August
item.description:
Near exit to Longford, road surface is potholed and breaking up. Also, road markings have become very faint, making it difficult to negotiate the roundabout safely. Whole roundabout needs repainting.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmbridge Court Roundabout, Elmbridge, Gloucester

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 14th August
item.description:
There are dead branches in the trees along the whole of Sydenham Road North, the trees are also incredibly high and have not been pollarded in years! We are concerned that a branch will break off and fall into our driveway damaging our vehicles
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Post or sign leaning slightly (less than 20 degrees) problem, 14th August
item.description:
I am writing as a resident of Gloucester Road, between Churchdown and the Arle Court roundabout, in the section where the Gloucester/Cheltenham cycle lane was recently installed. Previously, this stretch of road had a 50mph limit. Following the cycle path installation, the speed limit was reduced to 30mph to improve safety for cyclists and to reflect the narrowing of the road. While the 50mph signs have been removed, no 30mph signs have been installed in their place. Although the 30mph limit may be implied by street lighting, most drivers continue to travel at higher speeds. Given that this road has been 50mph for over three decades, its wide layout, and relatively sparse housing, it is easy for drivers to assume a higher speed limit. I fully support the cycle lane, which I see used regularly, including by myself. However, the absence of clear 30mph signage is contributing to speeding, creating a real safety risk—particularly at the junction with Bamfurlong Lane. I frequently observe vehicles, including HGVs, exceeding 30mph in this area, endangering cyclists and pedestrians. I strongly urge the installation of clear 30mph signage along the stretch between Churchdown and the start of the average speed camera on Gloucester Road, with particular attention to the Bamfurlong Lane junction which where I witness most of the safety hazards. This measure will significantly enhance safety for all road users. I would greatly appreciate being kept informed of the progress of this request.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Post or sign leaning slightly (less than 20 degrees)
